text: Rhotacism may refer to: * Rhotacism (sound change), the sound change converting a consonant into an r-sound * Rhotacism (speech impediment), the inability or difficulty in pronouncing the sound r Rhotacism may also refer to an excessive or idiosyncratic use of the letter r. == See also == * Rhotacisation, the articulation by which an r-coloured vowel is produced * Rhoticity: ** the property of a rhotic consonant ** the property that distinguishes rhotic and non-rhotic accents
title: Rhotacism
